In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Ventura Coastal - Tipton has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Ventura Coastal - Tipton now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Ventura Coastal - Tipton employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Ventura Coastal - Tipton will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

Strategically, we will respond minimally to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Ventura Coastal - Tipton has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Ventura Coastal - Tipton continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Ventura Coastal - Tiptons ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Ventura Coastal - Tiptons management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Ventura Coastal - Tipton has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with acce

ative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration processes. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration processes at the Ventura Coastal - Tipton facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. The ammonia process contains a total charge of approximately 40,000 (LBS). It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration processes and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Ventura Coastal - Tipton has had no defined accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Ventura Coastal - Tiptons emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
- Cal/OSHAs Emergency Action Plan  Title 8 CCR §3220
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans - Title 29 CFR §1910.38
- Cal/OSHAs Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 8 CCR §5189(n)
- U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements]- Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 §2765.1-2765.2
- USEPA Risk Management Program [Eme

zard.
Ventura Coastal Tipton is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps revealed that there are no faults in close proximity to the site. The USGS 2018 One-Year Model revealed that Ventura Coastal Tipton has a 1-2% chance of experiencing potentially minor-damage due to ground shaking in 2018.

1.2.3 Description of Covered Processes

The systems utilize a combination of liquid recirculation, flooded, and direct expansion (DX) operation. 

The South System primarily utilizes liquid recirculation (pumped overfeed). The South Silo, Lemon Essence Tank, Orange Essence Tank, Lemon Glycol Pre-Chiller, Permeate Glycol Chiller, and Orange Juice Glycol Chiller are configured for flooded operation.

The ATF System exclusively utilizes liquid recirculation (pumped overfeed). The S&T Juice Chiller and Feldmeier Chiller are the lone exceptions which are configured for flooded operation.

The COP System utilizes liquid recirculation for the three (3) oil tanks and direct expansion for the three (3) evaporators.

1.2.4 Process Classification

Each ammonia refrigeration system at Ventura Coastal Tipton consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. Process 1 - South is not interconnected with the other systems. The ATF and COP systems are interconnected by relief piping. As such, the refrigeration systems at Ventura Coastal Tipton are treated as two (2) independent processes.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meetings we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Ventura Coastal - Tipton has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and altern

worker and public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)
3. The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Descriptions

1.2.1 Facility Overview

Ventura Coastal Tipton operates a citrus juice processing facility in Tipton, CA. The facility has 
three (3) ammonia refrigeration systems which are referred to as:
System 1 - South System
System 2 - ATF System
System 3 - COP System

Each system provides refrigeration capacity to the following areas/components:

South System
(1) Freezer with (4) Evaporators
(1) Oil Mill with (1) Air Handling Unit
(1) Loading Dock with (1) Evaporator
(1) Juice Processing Tower
(1) Orange Juice Glycol Chiller (S&T)
(1) Permeate Glycol Chiller (P&F)
(2) Cold Wall Tank Room Chillers (P&F)
(1) Glycol Chiller (P&F)
(9) Cold Wall Tanks
(2) Essence Tanks
(1) Silo
(1) De-Oiler Tower

ATF System
(1) Delta Tee Chiller (S&T)
(1) Juice Chiller (S&T)
(6) Penthouse Evaporators
(2) Ceiling-Suspended Evaporators
(1) Slurry Ice Generator
(1) Glycol Chiller (P&F)
(12) Silos

COP System
(1) Loading Dock with (1) Evaporator
(1) Cold Storage Room with (2) Evaporators
(1) 2,000 Gallon Orange Oil Tank
(1) 2,000 Gallon Lemon Oil Tank
(1) 5,000 Gallon Oil Tank

1.2.2 Facility Location

Ventura Coastal Tipton is located at 531 West Poplar Avenue, Tipton, CA 93272. The latitude and longitude of the largest high pressure receiver (ATF System) is 36.049872, -119.313973. The facility is located approximately 500 feet west of state highway 99 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agriculture land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood ha

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program  Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP)  Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Ventura Coastal - Tipton has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Ventura Coastal - Tipton, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Ventura Coastal - Tipton has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                          | Process Chemical                     | Process Quantity(lbs.)
P1 - South System                    Anhydrous Ammonia                 13,000
P2 - ATF / COP                             Anhydrous Ammonia                 27,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.

Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant,
